results.title: Exploring Drug Repurposing for Treatment of Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms: a Systematic Review and Meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: This systematic review and meta-analysis suggests that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and statins may provide some effect in slowing @<m>DISEASE_Aortic_Aneurysm_Familial_Abdominal_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C565230 @@@AAA@@@ progression.

citations.NLM: Skovbo Kristensen JS, Krasniqi L, Obel LM, Kavaliunaite E, Liisberg M, Lindholt JS. Exploring Drug Repurposing for Treatment of Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms: a Systematic Review and Meta-analysis. Eur J Vasc Endovasc Surg. 2023 Nov 25;():. PMID: 38013062
citations.BibTeX: @article{38013062, title={Exploring Drug Repurposing for Treatment of Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms: a Systematic Review and Meta-analysis.}, author={Skovbo Kristensen JS and Krasniqi L and Obel LM and Kavaliunaite E and Liisberg M and Lindholt JS}, journal={Eur J Vasc Endovasc Surg}}

results.title: Top 10 candidate aortic disease trials.
results.text_hl: Currently, the most promising potential drug candidate to slow @<m>DISEASE_Aortic_Aneurysm_Familial_Abdominal_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C565230 @@@AAA@@@ growth is @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and RCTs to verify or reject this hypothesis are warranted.

citations.NLM: Dalman RL, Wanhainen A, Mani K, Modarai B. Top 10 candidate aortic disease trials. J Intern Med. 2020 Jul;288(1):23-37. PMID: 32187752
citations.BibTeX: @article{32187752, title={Top 10 candidate aortic disease trials.}, author={Dalman RL and Wanhainen A and Mani K and Modarai B}, journal={J Intern Med}, volume={288}, number={1}, pages={23-37}}
